intro: Aulaya pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered aulaya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Aulaya pauciflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
